portabout.para: NetBSD/cobalt is the port of NetBSD to Cobalt Networks' MIPS-based Microservers, now known as Sun Server Appliances.

portinfo.portml: NetBSD's port to Cobalt Networks MIPS-based Qube and RaQ machines
all of the MIPS-based NetBSD ports
portinfo.portlinkitem: GXemul, a functional machine emulator which also emulates Cobalt.

portnews.portnewsitem: NetBSD 5.0 has been released. More information is available in the 5.0 release announcement.
New restore CD of NetBSD/cobalt 5.0_RC2 using 200902260000Z snapshot is available for testing at .
New restore CD of NetBSD/cobalt 5.0_RC1 snapshot is available for testing at .
The first restore CD of NetBSD/cobalt 5.0_BETA using 20081103 snapshot is available for testing at . See instructions.txt for details.

New Restore CD build script and ISO image built from NetBSD/cobalt 4.0.1 release are available for testing and critique at . See README, CHANGES files in the tar.gz archive and instructions.txt for details.
NetBSD 4.0.1 has been released. More information is available in the 4.0.1 release announcement.
NetBSD 4.0 has been released. More information is available in the 4.0 release announcement.

NetBSD 3.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-3 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 53 architectures. More information is available in the 3.1 release announcement.

Dennis Chernoivanov has announced the availability of a new Restore CD build script, now available for testing and critique at . A NetBSD 3.99.17 restore CD built using these tools is available at . See his email to the port-cobalt mailing list for further details.
NetBSD 3.0 has been released with support for 57 architectures. More information is available in the 3.0 release announcement.

portsection.title: Supported System Models
portsection.para: All MIPS-based Qube and RaQ series systems from Cobalt Networks as well as the Gateway Micro Servers are supported.
The Phoenix Firewall Appliance Microserver and some versions of the Seagate NasRaQ may also be supported.
A built-in serial port is required for installation.

portsection.title: RaQ 3/4 Note
portsection.para: Note that the i386-based RaQ 3, RaQ 3i and RaQ 4 models are not supported by the cobalt port.
